GraphDrawing

Class DrawingArea

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • GraphDrawing.DrawingArea
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class DrawingArea
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Subclass of the JPanel class. A drawing area on which graphs can be drawn.
    Version:
    1.0.0, 1st June 2019
    Author:
    Clemens Hofstadler, Lukas Wögerer
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Graph G
      The graph to be drawn on the drawing area.
      private boolean linearEdges
      Boolean value determining whether the current layout of the graph requires linear edges or semicircular edges.
      private int size
      Size of the drawing area in pixel.
      private boolean threeDLayout
      Determines whether the currently displayed layout is 3D.
      private double x
      x-coordinate of the point which is fixed during the zoom (coordinate is given scaled to the unit square)
      private double xMoveCurrentMousePosition
      x-coordinate of the point where the image was at the current session of the click-and drag-movement.
      private double xMoveReference
      x-coordinate of the point which is used as a reference during moving the image by click and drag
      private double y
      y-coordinate of the point which is fixed during the zoom (coordinate is given scaled to the unit square)
      private double yMoveCurrentMousePosition
      y-coordinate of the point where the image was at the current session of the click-and drag-movement.
      private double yMoveReference
      y-coordinate of the point which is used as a reference during moving the image by click and drag
      private double zoom
      Zooming factor

      • size

        private int size
        Size of the drawing area in pixel.

      • G

        private Graph G
        The graph to be drawn on the drawing area.

      • linearEdges

        private boolean linearEdges
        Boolean value determining whether the current layout of the graph requires linear edges or semicircular edges.

      • zoom

        private double zoom
        Zooming factor

      • x

        private double x
        x-coordinate of the point which is fixed during the zoom (coordinate is given scaled to the unit square)

      • y

        private double y
        y-coordinate of the point which is fixed during the zoom (coordinate is given scaled to the unit square)

      • xMoveReference

        private double xMoveReference
        x-coordinate of the point which is used as a reference during moving the image by click and drag

      • yMoveReference

        private double yMoveReference
        y-coordinate of the point which is used as a reference during moving the image by click and drag

      • xMoveCurrentMousePosition

        private double xMoveCurrentMousePosition
        x-coordinate of the point where the image was at the current session of the click-and drag-movement.

      • yMoveCurrentMousePosition

        private double yMoveCurrentMousePosition
        y-coordinate of the point where the image was at the current session of the click-and drag-movement.

      • threeDLayout

        private boolean threeDLayout
        Determines whether the currently displayed layout is 3D. This enables rotations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DrawingArea

        public DrawingArea()
        Default constructor. Initializes an empty graph, sets the zoom to 1 and the initial position to the origin (upper left corner)

    • Method Detail

      • sizeDrawing

        public int sizeDrawing()
        Returns the current size of the drawing area.
        Returns:
        The current size of the drawing area.

      • threeDLayout

        public boolean threeDLayout()
        Returns whether the currently displayed layout is 3D.
        Returns:
        The value of the field "threeDLayout".

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int s)
        Changes the size of the drawing area to s.
        Parameters:
        s - Non-negative integer. The new size of the drawing area.

      • setGraph

        public void setGraph(Graph G)
        Sets the graph which will be drawn on the drawing area.
        Parameters:
        G - The graph which will be drawn on the drawing area.

      • setLinearEdges

        public void setLinearEdges(boolean b)
        Sets the boolean value of the field linearEdges.
        Parameters:
        b - The new value of the field linearEdges.

      • setThreeDLayout

        public void setThreeDLayout(boolean b)
        Sets the boolean value of the field threeDLayout.
        Parameters:
        b - The new value of the field threeDLayout.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the zoom to 1 and the position to the origin.

      • realX

        public double realX(double x0)
        Given an x-coordinate of the current displayed (possibly zoomed in) graph section, this method returns the x-coordinate w.r.t. the whole graph. Note that the x-coordinate has to be given scaled down to [0,1].
        Parameters:
        x0 - x-coordinate of a point from the currently shown graph section but scaled down to [0,1].
        Returns:
        x-coordinate w.r.t. the whole graph of the points which are currently shown at a position having x-coordinate x0.

      • realY

        public double realY(double y0)
        Given a y-coordinate of the current displayed (possibly zoomed in) graph section, this method returns the y-coordinate w.r.t. the whole graph. Note that the y-coordinate has to be given scaled down to [0,1].
        Parameters:
        y0 - y-coordinate of a point from the currently shown graph section but scaled down to [0,1].
        Returns:
        y-coordinate w.r.t. the whole graph of the points which are currently shown at a position having y-coordinate y0.

      • zoom

        public void zoom(double d,
                 double x0,
                 double y0)
        This method handles the zooming. The double value d determines whether the user wants to zoom in or out (d > 0 => zoom in; d < 0 => zoom out). During this zooming process the point (x0,y0) will be fixed.
        Parameters:
        d - Determines whether the user wants to zoom in our out.
        x0 - x-coordinate of the fixed point of the zoom scaled to [0,1].
        y0 - y-coordinate of the fixed point of the zoom scaled to [0,1],

      • firstClick

        public void firstClick(double ptX,
                       double ptY)
        Saves the position of the first click of the mouse somewhere inside the drawing area
        Parameters:
        ptX - x-coordinate of the position where the mouse was clicked but scaled down to the unit square.
        ptY - y-coordinate of the position where the mouse was clicked but scaled down to the unit square.

      • move

        public void move(double xNew,
                 double yNew)
        Moves the currently displayed picture to the position (xNew,yNew).
        Parameters:
        xNew - New x-coordinate.
        yNew - New y-coordinate.

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Overriden paint method. Paints the currently saved graph G on the graphics object g using the current zoom which fixes the currently saved point (x,y). If linearEdges is set to true, the graph will be drawn having linear edges. Otherwise edges are drawn as semicircles.
        Overrides:
        paint in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object on which the graph will be drawn.

      • save

        public void save(java.io.File f)
        Saves a picture of the currently drawn graph (including any zoom or maked nodes) in a png-file.
        Parameters:
        f - The file in which the picture will be saved.
